In an Excel table, I have recorded the engine performance of my car over the past year. I want to set up an automated system to monitor any changes in the performance. 
What are three key words or phrases that could make the sentence more effective? 
For example, would "real-time alerts," "predictive analysis," and "anomaly detection" be effective additions to the sentence? Or is there another set of words that would better capture the intention of the project?

The phrases "real-time alerts," "predictive analysis," and "anomaly detection" are indeed effective and relevant for setting up an automated system to monitor changes in your car's engine performance. These terms highlight the key functionalities you might want in your system. Here are some additional phrases that could also capture the intent of your project effectively:

1. **Performance Metrics Tracking**: This emphasizes the continuous measurement and monitoring of specific performance indicators.

2. **Data Visualization**: This involves creating graphical representations of data, making it easier to spot trends and patterns.

3. **Trend Analysis**: This focuses on identifying patterns or trends over time to predict future performance issues.

Incorporating any combination of these terms can effectively communicate the objectives and functionalities of your automated monitoring system.
